New Records: Mitchell Santner became the first New Zealand spinner to register a five-wicket haul in Men's Cricket World Cup history
Key Match Events: Will Young scored a smooth 70 off 80
Rachin Ravindra scored a half-century for New Zealand
Trent Boult took a superb catch on the boundary
New Zealand adopted an aggressive approach throughout their innings to belt out a big total in Hyderabad
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand were boosted by the return of Lockie Ferguson in place of James Neesham
Netherlands made two changes into their XI, Klein and Sybrand Engelbrecht made it into the playing XI
Bas De Leede is out to make his own mark on the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup while following in the footsteps of his father Tim De Leede
Post-Match Reflections: Aryan Dutt (2/60), and Paul van Meekeren (2/59) led the Netherlands bowling effort
Colin Ackermann (69) and Scott Edwards (30) were the other notable contributors for the Netherlands
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dutch chase got off to a rocky start when Vikramjit Singh (12) was bowled in the sixth over
Dutch lost out on Teja Nidamanuru to a mix up in the middle in the 26th over
New Zealand reached 322/7 at the end of their innings
Others: Rachin Ravindra is out to make his mark in India while playing for New Zealand at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
Colin Ackermann messed up a switch hit and gifted a catch to the Short Third, while Edwards fell trying to slog
